Question ======== Use the following help file excerpt to answer the question below. ::: {.cell layout-align="center" printr.help.sections='usage'} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
corR Documentation

Correlation, Variance and Covariance (Matrices)

Usage

var(x, y = NULL, na.rm = FALSE, use)

cov(x, y = NULL, use = "everything",
    method = c("pearson", "kendall", "spearman"))

cor(x, y = NULL, use = "everything",
    method = c("pearson", "kendall", "spearman"))

cov2cor(V)
``` ::: ::: What is the default value for the `use` argument of the `cor()` function? Answerlist ---------- * `"everything"` * `"Everything` * `"spearman"` * `"pearson"` * `"kendall"` * `c("pearson", "spearman", "kendall")` * `NULL` * `method` * `y` * `x` * The `use` argument does not have a defined default value. Solution ======== The default value for the `use` argument is `"everything"`. Answerlist ---------- * Correct * Wrong: The "E" should be lowercase * Wrong: This is one of the possible methods * Wrong: This is one of the possible methods * Wrong: This is one of the possible methods * Wrong: These are all of the possible methods * Wrong: This is the default value for `y` * Wrong: This is an argument name * Wrong: This is an argument name * Wrong: This is an argument name * Wrong: There is a default value defined for `use`.
